lexUnit.name: detect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: discover or identify the presence or existence of.

sentence.text: A checker that detects errors simply by lexical look-up will obviously fail to spot ` real world " errors , such as wether for whether , i.e. where a misspelling has transformed one English word into another .
The Mann-Whitney U test was used to detect differences in continuous dependent variables ( age , pack years , ounce years ) between the two groups .
This lateral line system enables the fish to detect differences of pressure in the water .
CANCER may soon be detected in its earliest stages -- even before cells begin to appear abnormal .
She thought she detected the ghost of amusement in his blue eyes and it incensed her even more .
Single-celled protozoa can detect the chemicals in their food and move towards them .
Complexes and unbound probe were detected by autoradiography of dried gels .
Even a single cyst of Giardia can be detected by the PCR , and this is a reasonable sensitivity for environmental testing .
Helium ( He ) has been detected by spacecraft though it has such a weak spectral signature that its abundance has been estimated by indirect means .
I detect something happening to the profile of the flying binbag ; at the top of its arc the shape bulges in its upper surface , a small clenched fist bursts through , punching the dark .
Meredith thought she detected a gentler tone creeping into his words , and felt comforted , but then he spoilt it all .
One can therefore detect gamma ray bursts by looking for flashes of light in the night sky .
The lesion is not always easily detected on endoscopic examination , especially when it is not actively bleeding .
Poison was too easily detected .
Normally subjects were able to detect the presence of this gap equally well whether the square was presented to left or right of the fixation point .
Because it is electrically charged , the beta particle can be detected fairly easily .
Although digoxin is easily detected in fresh blood it is far more difficult to trace in fresh body tissue and harder again to detect in old samples of either flesh or blood .
Bernice thought she detected more than a suggestion of injured pride in his rigid stance .
Through all of this , I detect a consistent and unhealthy bias .
It detects heat .
Lysozyme mRNA positive cells were detected in all sections from the eight patients with Crohn 's disease .
This particular mine could not be detected by the ordinary mine detector .
We may also detect a crisis of national consciousness in the old nations , and for similar reasons .
A weak probe laser detects the holes in the same way as for the simple memory .
It has been detected in a dozen systems in the US and yesterday the Swiss government announced that 75 of its computers were infected .
Almost , Sara thought , one might detect a certain amount of satisfaction in her tones .
Was that boredom she could detect in his voice ?
I detect a definite note of cynicism in Amanda 's prose regarding her homeland , and personally she may have good reason to feel bitter .
Airport security was largely superficial , and outdated equipment could not detect plastic explosives .
This should detect half of affected boys .
If you can not detect even the shallowest of breaths , attempt artificial respiration making sure the chest starts to rise .
